title: Derby’s Take: As Fed Officials Weigh Taper, Mortgage-Buying Could Be Point of Contention
sub_head: With a rocketing housing market, some wonder whether the mortgage component of the Fed’s asset purchases is pouring fuel on a fire
body:
As Federal Reserve officials edge toward a debate on the winddown of their asset-buying stimulus program, their purchases of mortgage bonds could become a focal point of a shift in monetary policy.
Since the start of the coronavirus pandemic over a year ago, the Fed has sought to pack more stimulative power into its monetary policy by joining its near-zero interest rate stance with hefty purchases of Treasury and mortgage bonds.
